newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU experts expected to approve U.S. grain quota.
newsitem.headline: EU experts expected to approve U.S. grain quota.

text.p: The European Union's rice management committee may decide on Thursday details of export certificates need for the import of U.S. rice under GATT quota arrangements, a European Union (EU) official said on Tuesday.
"The arrangements of the GATT world arrangement were delayed because the U.S. had not sorted out their own administrative arrangements. A vote is expected," the official said.
The quota arrangement will allow the United States to export to the EU 38,721 tonnes of milled and semi-milled rice, 7,642 tonnes of husked rice and 5,461 tonnes of broken rice.
If adopted the quota will be open for bids five days after the regulation comes into force which will be three days after publication in the EU Official Journal. -- Brussels Newsroom 32 2 287 6800
